name: Sales Rep Direct Report - Surgical Instrument Defect
description: Sales representative submitting structured internal complaint report about surgical instrument quality issue discovered during demo.

headers.subject: Product Complaint - Laparoscopic Grasper Lot QC Issue

raw_input.body:
INTERNAL PRODUCT COMPLAINT REPORT
================================

Submitted by: Sarah Johnson, Senior Sales Representative
Date: April 18, 2024
Region: Mountain West

PRODUCT INFORMATION:
- Product Name: SurgiGrip Laparoscopic Grasper, 5mm
- Catalog Number: SG-LAP-5-GR
- Lot Number: SG2024-03-445
- Expiration: March 2026

INCIDENT DETAILS:
- Date Discovered: April 18, 2024
- Location: University Medical Center - Denver (demo/evaluation)
- Device Used on Patient: NO

DESCRIPTION:
During a scheduled product evaluation at University Medical Center today, Dr. Ramirez (Chief of Minimally Invasive Surgery) and I opened 4 units from lot SG2024-03-445 for inspection.

3 of the 4 units had visible jaw misalignment - the grasper jaws did not close evenly. When tested on the practice tissue model, these units did not grip properly and would not have provided adequate tissue purchase during surgery.

The 4th unit appeared to function correctly.

Dr. Ramirez declined to proceed with the evaluation trial and has put further orders on hold pending resolution.

ACTION TAKEN:
- All 4 units retained and sealed in original packaging
- Labeled with date and issue description
- Will ship to QA per standard procedure
- Customer notified we are investigating

IMPACT:
- No patient exposure
- Demo evaluation cancelled
- $50K potential order at risk
- Customer confidence affected

Please advise on:
1. Whether to quarantine other stock from this lot at our distribution centers
2. Customer communication guidance
3. Timeline for investigation

Sarah Johnson
Senior Sales Representative
SurgiTool Medical - Mountain West
Cell: (555) 888-9900

event_info.event_description: During product evaluation, 3 of 4 laparoscopic graspers from same lot showed visible jaw misalignment. Jaws did not close evenly and failed to grip properly on test tissue model. Devices not used on patients.
event_info.patient_outcome: No patient exposure - discovered during demo
event_info.device_outcome: All 4 units retained and sealed, to be shipped to QA

expected_complaint.narrative: During product evaluation at University Medical Center Denver, 3 of 4 SurgiGrip Laparoscopic Grasper units from lot SG2024-03-445 showed visible jaw misalignment. Jaws did not close evenly and failed to grip adequately on practice tissue model. Devices were not used on patients. All units retained for QA analysis. Issue discovered before clinical use.

ground_truth.coding_rationale: A07 (Mechanical Problem) for jaw misalignment. C10 (No Patient Problem) as devices never used on patients. No MDR required - quality issue discovered before patient use, no harm potential realized.

extraction_challenges: Structured internal format - different from customer emails
Business impact info mixed with complaint details
Multiple units affected from same lot
Must recognize no patient exposure despite surgical context
notes: Good example of quality issue caught before patient impact. Structured sales rep format makes extraction easier. Lot-level issue suggests manufacturing problem.
